Forward Service. Provides auto-routing of DICOM objects that are received by the DICOM Storage Service to remote DICOM applications. This is done by queuing corresponding retrieve requests to the Move SCU service. org.dcm4chex.archive.dcm.movescu.ForwardService The default constructor ForwardService List of forwarding rules, dependent upon which application - identified by the Calling AE title - sent the objects, and also dependent upon which called AE title was used in the Association Request. When the StoreScp service accepts several called AE titles (configured by the CalledAETitles attribute in the StoreScp service), different Store SCU applications (e.g. modalities) can be configured to use different called AE titles in their Association Requests to the same DICOM server of the archive. The comma separated list of AE titles after the (optional) condition defines the forwarding destination (the other Storage SCP) by its Called AE Title. Each AE title can be suffixed by !- to defer forwarding to that destination outside a particular time interval.
Format:
[calling|called[!]=aeTitleFrom]aeTitleTo!from-to | NONE
where
calling = create a forward condition for objects sent from this calling AE title
called = create a forward condition for objects are forwarded from the Called AE title in the Association request. Use != to mean NOT.
aeTitleFrom = the calling AE titles, or the called AE titles, separated by commas
aeTitleTo = the AE titles that objects are forwarded to, in a comma-separated list (optional)
!from-to = start and end hour (0-23) when no forwarding should be performed for the aeTitleTo (Storage SCP) value (optional)
NONE = do not use any forwarding rules.
Example:
[calling=SCU1|SCU2,called!=SCP0]SCP3,SCP4!8-16
Forwards objects received from AE Title SCU1 or SCU2, when the Called AE Title in the Association Request is NOT SCP0, to Storage SCPs, SCP3 and SCP4. Forwarding of objects received between 8am and 4pm to SCP4 is delayed until 4 pm. ForwardingRules java.lang.String Forwarding priority. Enumerated Values: LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH.
